intro: Morisonia hastata, commonly known as the Florida morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial with trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, blooming in the early morning. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Morisonia hastata is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds.
